page.title: 14DISUSED RAILWAY
page.content: The disused railway line is more like a country path than a once used railway. It is now completely overgrown with weeds and grass. There are a lot of wild flowers as well as stinging nettles which are growing by the side of it as well as all over it. Hawthorn, oak and sycamore trees are also growing along the track. We picked up some clinker from the path. These are bits of stone which were left at the bottom of the furnace in steam engines and were thrown out by the fireman on the train. We passed under 3 bridges and noticed black marks still on the bridges. These marks are from the smoke which rose from the old steam engines. There was ivy growing over the bridges. The track runs from Burton Green to Berkswell and measures 2572 metres.
